definition: pictogram/one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
elephant/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/shape/form/appearance/to imitate
to appear/to look/form/shape
pictogram/hieroglyph
pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph

sentences.english: It is a pictographic character too.
They are the hieroglyphics of feudalism succeeding those of theocracy .
sentences.chinese: 這是繼神權政治象形文字之後的封建制度象形文字。

sentences.english: They are the hieroglyphics of feudalism succeeding those of theocracy .
sentences.chinese: 這是繼神權政治象形文字之後的封建制度象形文字。

sentences.english: Grouping is typically seen in early pictographic languages - the combined symbols representing a new concept - and the researchers suspect that prehistoric Europeans had established a similar system.
sentences.chinese: 在早期的象形文字語言中，成組聚集是經典特色。

sentences.english: Alphabetic writing in English belonging to the Chinese is hieroglyphs, ways of thinking are different.
sentences.chinese: 英文屬於拼音文字而中文是象形文字，思維方式不同。

sentences.english: The pictograph for a mountain was originally three peaks together.
sentences.chinese: 山的象形字原來是三座山峯堆在一起的。

sentences.english: Pictograph is the base of conformation of Chinese character.
sentences.chinese: 象形字是漢字構造的基礎。

sentences.english: Visual cues are key in pictograms.
sentences.chinese: 在象形圖中視覺線索是關鍵。

sentences.english: Some of the earliest written Chinese characters were quite pictographic.//
sentences.chinese: 一些最古老的文字屬象形文字。

sentences.english: Chinese writings are pictographs. They are like pictures, very complicated.
sentences.chinese: 中文是象形文字，猶如一個圖畫，很複雜。

sentences.english: Mayan hieroglyphics in the Dresden Codex.
sentences.chinese: 在德累斯頓抄本瑪雅象形文字。

sentences.english: "Mountain" in Chinese is a pictograph character which has its origin in the shape of the mountain.
sentences.chinese: “山”是個象形字，是由大山的形態演化而來的。

sentences.english: Shape imitation and meaning imitation are two expressive features of pictograph.
sentences.chinese: 擬形和擬意是象形文字的兩大表現特徵。

sentences.english: Aquarius is an air sign, like Gemini and Libra.
sentences.chinese: 水瓶座和雙子座，天秤座一樣都是風象形作。

definition: pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
to create Chinese characters/cf Six Methods of forming Chinese characters 六書|六书[liu4 shu1]
pictogram/hieroglyph
combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
oracle script/oracle bone character (an early form of Chinese script)
inscription in bronze/bell-cauldron inscription

Six Methods of forming Chinese characters, according to Han dictionary Shuowen 說文|说文 - namely, two primary methods: 象形 (pictogram), 指事 (ideogram), two compound methods: 會意|会意 (combined ideogram), 形聲|形声 (ideogram plus phonetic), and two transfer methods: 假借 (loan), 轉注|转注 (transfer)
phono-semantic compound character
seal script used throughout the pre-Han period
original meaning/literal sense
form of a Chinese character/variant of 字型[zi4 xing2]
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
phonetic/phonological/transliteration
